page.title: 16Copper Mines at Clive
page.content: {The Copper Mine}at Clive is situated at{Mine Bank},down the lane from the Church and is marked by a small building alongside the road and a row of mineworkers cottages. The Mine is not now worked, but at least three shafts and a total of one mile of underground workings still remain. Copper was mined from the early 17th century but was most important in the {mid-19th century}when ore was drawn off to lower levels and then raised to the surface in skips by means of the winding shaft. The copper carbonate ore was leached with Hydrochloric Acid and then the copper was precipitated from solution using tanks of scrap iron.
